messages.content: Step 1: Understand Zakat Obligations
Zakat is obligatory for Muslims who meet specific wealth conditions. Make sure you fulfil the following:

content: You possess wealth above the Nisab threshold (approx. market value of 86 grams of gold).
You have held this wealth for one lunar year (haul).

messages.content: Do you meet these criteria?
Step 2: Calculate Your Zakat
Calculate your zakat amount accurately using trusted tools.

content: Use the Zakat calculators for Savings, Business, Gold, etc.

messages.content: Have you calculated your Zakat?
Step 3: Choose a Payment Method
MUIS offers several convenient payment methods for Zakat.
Which method would you like to use?
Step 4: Make the Payment
Proceed to make your Zakat payment using your chosen method.
Remember to retain the receipt or screenshot of the transaction for your records.
Have you completed the payment?
Step 5: Confirm and Track Your Zakat
Ensure your payment went through and check your giving history.

content: Check your email for an e-receipt.
Log in to [Zakat.sg](https://www.zakat.sg/) to view your zakat history.
Reach out to MUIS if you did not receive confirmation.

messages.content: Did you receive confirmation?
Step 6: Jazakumullahu Khayran!
Thank you for fulfilling your Zakat obligation. May Allah accept it from you and bless your wealth.
You can track your Zakat history, view receipts, and learn more about Zakat distribution via the MUIS Zakat portal.
